cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi south of the mouth of the Mississippi River, or 145 mi southeast of Houma, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward southeastern Louisiana, then turning north across Mississippi and northeast toward the Tennessee/Ohio Valleys

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA to the AL/FL border (storm-surge watch/warning area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River (hurricane); Mouth of the Pearl River to AL/FL border (tropical-storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas across Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible in outer rainbands (20–30 mph) but sustained gale conditions are improbable
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the west-central Florida coast near Port Manatee
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered squalls could produce 1–3 in of rain through Monday–Tuesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along the Gulf beaches of west-central Florida
